intro: Parosela calliantha, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Parosela calliantha is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
